programme.title: Wildest Islands: Sri Lanka: Monsoon Island
programme.desc: Lying like a teardrop in the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka is an island that defies convention. Poised just six degrees above the equator, it's less than 75,000 km sq in size. But it has enough wildlife to rival a continent.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Congo: the Untamed Heart
programme.desc: Known for centuries as Africa's Dark Heart, the Congo is a multi-layered, three-dimensional world, seething with innumerable species. By peeling back the layers, we discover how this vast rainforest works, and expose the hidden lives of its inhabitants.

programme.title: Wildest Middle East: Arabia: Land of Illusions
programme.desc: The Arabian peninsula is an ancient land of illusion. Extreme heat seems to sap life out of every corner. Yet, tricks of the light and the art of deception make survival possible. Nothing is as it seems.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Galapagos: Darwin's Eden
programme.desc: The Galapagos archipelago contains 13 main islands and a hundred or so smaller rocks and reefs. The region's wilderness is so pristine and rich in life. / Lying like a teardrop in the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka is an island that defies convention.

programme.title: Wildest Middle East: Turkey: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: Turkey is a land of contrasts, where the wildlife faces extreme challenges. Mountains, altitude, climatic changes, hostile coastlines, and earthquakes all play their part but, somehow, the wildlife battles the odds and survives.

programme.title: Poor Boy's Game

programme.title: Leaves of Grass

programme.title: Andromeda: Star-Crossed

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Out of the Dark

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost for Words

programme.desc: A chilling investigation of John Ernest Cribb, who on August 11, 1978 broke into the home of the Connell's. On a winter’s afternoon, Valda Connell and her four-year-old son Damien arrived home after having collected ten-year-old Sally from school.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: No Mercy: The Killing of Virginia Morse
programme.desc: The horrific story of killers Allan Baker and Kevin Crump who began their murderous spree in rural NSW by killing a complete stranger for $20, a packet of cigarettes and a couple of litres of petrol.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Predator: Leonard John Fraser

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Tess is finding it tough going with Stevie. She’s insolent and competitive and as far as Tess is concerned not a team player. When a private investigator turns up looking for Stevie, Tess is convinced she has something to hide.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Six months on from Claire’s death, Tess (Bridie Carter) has thrown herself into her work with an almost manic intensity.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: Late at night Tess (Bridie Carter) is woken by a strange noise in the kitchen and discovers Stevie helping herself to a beer from the fridge. Both however are subsequently surprised by a stranger called Jack Blake.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters
programme.desc: When Harry (Marshall Napier) offers Alex (Aaron Jeffery) and Nick (Myles Pollard) a partnership deal in Killarney after he dies on the proviso that they give up Wilgul and move back home now, the boys become even more determined to save their farm.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Mystery of Mona Lisa
programme.desc: When Lyssa points out that the fugitive in the next case has the same birth date as Barbara, Dog's recently deceased daughter, the team takes a special vow to capture the young woman.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Rusty Cuffs
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies; the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Make a Wish
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children, then starting the search for Jacob, a fugitive who's abandoned his wife and children.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tough Love
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surprise Ending
programme.desc: Dog and the boys are going after a fugitive with a $25,000 bond and a string of theft charges behind him. When the team hits his apartment, they find a boot print on the door, a souvenir of a police raid from only days earlier?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Big Wipe-Out
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: You Can Bet On It!
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag". Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own, getting the help of trusty informants he's helped out over the years.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fly Boy
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck No, We Won't Go
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drag Me To Glory
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Season Eve
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Can't Hardly Weight
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Shot Thru The Heart
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Lizard, Lizard
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hallu-Si-Nations
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous 'Black Panther'.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Let's Go Hunting, Deer
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city." At Phil and Kay's, Miss Kay decides she wants to frame Phil's original blueprints from the first duck call he created.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Tickets To The Fun Show
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room. The massage chair becomes a detriment to the workflow, so Willie takes Si around for a replacement prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Be a Lady
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Behind Bars: The World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: Once, inmates in Armenian prisons fell into the hands of the "Thieves in Law," a criminal brotherhood rejecting state authority and living by its own code.

programme.title: Behind Bars: The World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: La Mesa, A Mexican prison just over the US border. The inmates? Drug traffickers, rapists, cartel killers. They have tough times ahead.

programme.title: Behind Bars: The World's Toughest Prisons: Tent City Jail, Phoenix, Arizona, USA
programme.desc: Old army tents left over from the Korean War house prisoners instead of cells. The Sheriff is a hard man who refuses to spend any more than he has to on his prisoners. Harassment and humiliation is a part of everyday life at Tent City.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 9
programme.desc: Broward County law enforcement and fire rescue tackle a daily onslaught of cases tied to the dangerous new synthetic drug Flakka . And a Ft Lauderdale Flakka addict named Glenn undertakes what may be his last chance at recovery.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 10
programme.desc: When night falls on the Rio Grande comes to life with drug smugglers. Border Patrol counters by dispatching highly-trained Special Operations units, with agents drawn from the elite tactical unit BORTAC and the Mobile Response Team (MRT).

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 11
programme.desc: Border Patrol agents race to apprehend illegal crossers working under the cover of night in a dangerous portion of the Rio Grande. And South Florida law enforcement tackles the heroin epidemic that is sweeping America

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 12
programme.desc: Border Patrol Agents in Arizona chase an undocumented alien who’s jumped the border fence and crossed into the US illegally.

programme.title: Drug Wars: Episode 13
programme.desc: A SWAT Team from Miramar Florida executes a search warrant on a dangerous drug dealer. And Custom and Border Protection Officers in Miami work on another front line in the war on drugs as they seize an alarming amount of drugs

programme.title: Divorce Court: Enough Is Enough
programme.desc: Dwight has had it with Roxy's mental abuse. Dwight says Roxy has cost him multiple jobs because she's constantly harassing him at work, but she says he needs to give her the attention she deserves! Can Judge Toler help them see eye to eye?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Blame It on the Alcohol
programme.desc: Nikkinba says Muriel is controlling and constantly breaking his phones. He wouldn't return Muriel's calls for days until he quit his job and said that he's leaving her to live in North Carolina. Can they settle down or will he buy a one-way ticket?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Pour Up Drank
programme.desc: Floyd Steven’s jealousy is leading Alqueisha “Quey” Benjamin to consider breaking it off. Quey is becoming an alcoholic because of his controlling ways, but Floyd has caught her in a few lies and suspects her of cheating!

programme.title: Divorce Court: Back Seat of My Jeep
programme.desc: Bumping in the night in the back seat of his jeep has caused all our problems! Kelsey says Justin cheats, doesn’t pay bills and is always angry. Justin argues that she’s a liar and doesn’t help around the house ever.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Heart Break Hotel
programme.desc: Brianna says Steven constantly looks at other women behind her back which has taken a toll on her confidence. He says her overprotectiveness leads to arguments that end up with her accusing him of cheating.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Hashtag Freaky
programme.desc: Anita says Ronald is a chronic cheater and a sex addict. He demands sex constantly and when doesn’t get his way, he admits he feels forced to seek sex outside the marriage. Can Judge Toler save this couple?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 1
programme.desc: Jacoby Garrett is fighting to save his marriage of 15 years. Meanwhile his wife, Kim Garrett has her belongings packed and is waiting on the moving truck.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 2
programme.desc: Jacoby says his wife has stolen money to feed her gambling addiction. Kim says that his mother is a huge thorn in her side. In 15 years, Kim says she is still scratching her head as to why Jacoby’s mother bad mouths her to everyone.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Old Town Road
programme.desc: Jennifer says Josh's lies have left her and their family homeless. He has made many hurtful decisions like selling her car and dumping her dog while she was giving birth to their son. Can he pave the way for a future?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Family Guy
programme.desc: Jazmin's final straw was when Darren brought another woman over and lied about Jazmin being his sister and his daughter being his niece. Darren feels he's a good father who pays the bills and doesn't need to answer to anyone if he's not married.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Game Boy
programme.desc: Christy is done with Demetrice's video game obsession! He said he's better off with his games than being accused of looking at every woman that passes by. Will Demetrice snap back into reality or is this game over?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Down in the DM
programme.desc: Clifford feels that Asia is always searching for things that aren’t there. Asia says she is done with Clifford and the way he uses social media to flirt and cheat with women. Can Judge Lynn Toler help put a stop to the arguing?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Should Have Seen This Coming
programme.desc: First, Lou, Sonia, and Froy unfurl an elaborate sting when they repo a taxicab by tricking its driver into picking them up. But what to do with his ferociously inebriated client?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Vampires and Drunks
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia take a trip to Beverly Hills to interrupt the salon appointment of a wealthy trophy wife who isn't going to let her prized possession go without a fight. Then, Sonia and Matt use the cover of night to sneak away a Nissan.

programme.title: Operation Repo: I Don't Know What That Is
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy crash a raucous brew-fest to sneak an ATV away from a crowd of tipsy revelers. Then, Matt and Lou come face-to-face with a fraternity prank gone awry - these college kids have a sledgehammer, and they're not afraid to use it.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Incompetent and Unfaithful
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy slip into a gated community for a repossession only to attract the attention of a trio of irate and incompetent security guards. Then, Lou and Sonia come face-to-face with a debtor and her entire adult-league softball team.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Don't Cry, Bro
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy track a car to the compound of what seems to be a polygamist cult. Will their charismatic leader put up a fight for his Prius, or will he have his followers do it for him?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Don't Spray Me with That
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy repossess an experimental concept motorcycle from a hose-wielding yuppie. Then, Froy and Sonia head to a casting agency to repossess a car from a two-faced receptionist with a special talent for four-letter words.

programme.title: Operation Repo: There Was an Accident
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy head to a supermarket to repossess a Mitsubishi from a truant bagboy, but they'll also have to contend with a furious shopper. Then, Matt and Froy find their car, but it's been heavily vandalized.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Go Kart Them Away
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy repossess a car from a cheating husband who's shacked up at a nearby motel. His wife probably isn't going to be too happy to hear about this. Then, Sonia and Lyndah crash a high school reunion to confront an over-the-hill jock.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Yoga-to Be Kidding Me
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy head into a nice part of town to repossess a BMW from an entitled yuppie, but first they'll have to contend with his rampaging long-distance girlfriend. Then, Lou, Lyndah, and Matt venture into a trailer park.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Repo, the Final Frontier
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia trace an out-of-state skip account to a seedy motel, where they come face-to-face with a hopping-mad cowboy and his female companion. Then, Matt and Sonia go where no repo man has gone before to repossess a Ford.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Coffee-slinging Waitress
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy storm a studio to repossess a Corvette from a surly European photographer and his hapless, bikini-clad subjects. Then, Lou and Matt stumble into a lover's quarrel - will they be able to reclaim the vehicle from two suited suitors?

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Sistas: A Brick Wall
programme.desc: Danni finds herself in a compromising predicament and receives unsolicited help from El Fuego. (S4, ep1)

programme.title: The Game
programme.desc: Chardonnay's sorority sister is in town to cheer her up after hearing of her divorce. Jason makes a play to get back with Kelly. Malik joins Keira at her acting class.

programme.title: The Game
programme.desc: Jason rents Phatty's for a private dinner with Kelly, taking an enhancement drug in the process. Malik tries to quell his feelings for Keira, leading to some awkward moments.

programme.title: The Game
programme.desc: Things heat up on the Season 8 finale. Jason gets a serious promotion. Blue starts to suspect that there is something going on between Malik and Keira. Malik and Keira let their emotions get the best of them.

programme.title: The Game: Away Game
programme.desc: Derwin invites Melanie to his first away game in Miami, but due to her heavy school load, she decides to pass.

programme.title: The Game: The Rules Of The Game
programme.desc: As a favor to Derwin, Melanie attends the first Saber Sunbeam meeting of the season, only to learn that unlike the wives, football players "girlfriends" are not considered legitimate and are treated as such by the other wives.

programme.title: The Game: Gifted
programme.desc: When Melanie sends gifts to the football team on behalf of Derwin in honor of the first game, Derwin gets teased and his teammates Jason and Malik feel pressured to reciprocate. A gift giving competition ensues.

programme.title: The Game: How Tasha Got Her Groove Back
programme.desc: When Malik tells Tasha that he is having trouble with the offensive coordinator, Kenny, he asks her to speak with him.

programme.title: The Game: Brittany's Super Sweet Sixth
programme.desc: When Kelley's daughter tells her she wants an extravagant birthday party like the rest of her friends, Kelly approaches Jason for money and he refuses.

programme.title: The Game: Rift And Separate
programme.desc: A minor argument escalates into a major locker room rigt between Jason and Malik that affects their playing relationship on the field.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Suicide Possession
programme.desc: Joan and her boyfriend Tony are seeing apparitions in their New Jersey home. Both are concerned that the spirits are influencing their behavior: a non-drinker, Tony has turned to the bottle while Joan has thoughts of harming herself.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Shape Shifter
programme.desc: PRS travels to Shapleigh, Maine where a woman and her daughter are reporting attacks from a winged creature with sharp teeth. Psychic Chip Coffey arrives and senses a half-human, half animal presence.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Darkness Falls
programme.desc: Ryan leads his team to one of the most haunted places in the US to confront their fears and solve a paranormal mystery. Aside from the alleged spirits of dead prisoners, something even darker may be lurking inside West Virginia State Penitentiary.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Haunted Connection

programme.title: World's Greatest: Mountains
programme.desc: The earth’s fragile crust has folded and faulted, and nowhere are these natural forces more evident than in the world’s great mountains. Explore the highest peaks of the world’s terrain - the rugged realm between heaven and earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanic Islands
programme.desc: They've been worshiped and feared over the millennia. But in the wake of drama and destruction, the elements give rise to cultures and nations so beautiful that we've come to know them as the world's greatest volcanic islands.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Deserts
programme.desc: For all their reputation as inhospitable places, deserts are full of incredible plants and animals that have adapted to the climate. They are bursting with geological wonders that inspire and are home to some of the most life in the world.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Remote Cities
programme.desc: Brave the frontiers of the world’s most remote cities. More than distant trading posts and isolated regional hubs, cities like Alice Springs, Jaipur and even Las Vegas serve as gateways to the wild places of the Earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Nearshore Islands
programme.desc: Some of the world’s greatest islands are so close that they blend in with the mainland. But regardless of their size and origins, they are often the islands we are drawn to the most, each forging their own unique identity.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur and The Crunch Cereal Contest/D.W. Flips
programme.desc: A year's supply of Crunch Cereal is in store for the person who can write the new Crunch Cereal jingle, and Arthur is sure he can do it. Next, how hard can it be to do a cartwheel on a balance beam? D.W. is about to find out.

programme.title: Arthur: Adventures in Budylon/Ladonna Compson: Party Animal
programme.desc: D.W. and Bud embark on an epic wilderness adventure--the backyard has never been so exciting! Apple picking, bake sales, craft classes…there's so much to do in Elwood City in the fall! And Ladonna's determined to do it all.

programme.title: Arthur: Whip. Mix. Blend./Staycation
programme.desc: When Rattles's mom starts dating Archie Vanderloo, Rattles finds himself spending time with his twins, but they don’t have anything in common. Arthur offers to babysit so that his parents can enjoy some peace and quiet in the backyard.

programme.title: Arthur: The Cherry Tree/Matchmaker Matchbreaker
programme.desc: Muffy wants a Bouncy Castle at her party, but when her favorite cherry tree is cut down to make room for it, she starts to have regrets. Francine and Muffy scheme to set up their older siblings Chip and Catherine, but plans go awry.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W., All Fired Up/I'd Rather Read It Myself
programme.desc: When Ms. Morgan announces they'll be having a fire drill during preschool, D.W. wants no part of it--it sounds way too scary. Then, the Tibble Twins are better than D.W. at just about everything.

programme.title: Arthur: The Pea and the Princess/D.W. and Dr. Whosit
programme.desc: The 3rd grade class is putting on a production of “The Princess and the Pea,” and Prunella is at the helm as director! Then, Mom and Dad tell D.W. she’s too young to watch a new television show that everyone is talking about.

programme.title: Arthur: Speak Up Francine/Waiting for Snow
programme.desc: The local creek is polluted and pesticide run-off is to blame. Francine is determined to get the word out at the annual Earth Day rally. Ladonna can't wait to experience her first blizzard, if only the weather would cooperate.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur Weighs In/The Law of the Jungle Gym
programme.desc: When Arthur doesn't fit into his costume for the play, he's shocked to learn that he's gotten "husky-sized." He gets serious about getting in shape. Muffy found the perfect place to take pictures with her new digital camera: the jungle gym.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's First Sleepover/Arthur's New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Have you ever been afraid of the dark? Despite D.W.'s threat of aliens, Arthur sets his tent for his first sleepover. Then, what exactly happens at midnight, December 31st? There are plenty of rumors, but no one seems to know for sure.

programme.title: War Story: Across the Rhine: Paras in Germany
programme.desc: In mid-September 1944, the remnants of the battered 1st Canadian Parachute Battalion participated in the largest parachute drop in history, fought a successful battle.

programme.title: War Story: Vengeance
programme.desc: In 1941, nearly 30,000 Jews escaped the ghettos and work camps and they joined the growing underground resistance army, actively fighting the Nazis.

programme.title: War Story: Prisoners of the Sun
programme.desc: On 16 November 1941, two Canadian battalions arrived in the British colony of Hong Kong. Their aim: Bolster the Empire’s defenses in the event of aggression by the restless forces of Japan, stationed only kilometres away in occupied China.

programme.title: War Story: The Last Ship: The Sinking of the Esquimalt
programme.desc: On 16 April 1945, a mere three weeks before German surrender, the submarine fired a single torpedo that sank the last Canadian naval vessel lost to enemy action.

programme.title: War Story: Buchenwald Airmen
programme.desc: For two months in 1944, 168 Allied airmen were shot down over occupied France, betrayed to the Gestapo by the same collaborator, transported to the Nazi concentration and slave labour camp Buchenwald.

programme.title: War Story
programme.desc: In the longest campaign of the Second World War, from 1939 to 1945, German submarines desperately try to sever Britain’s shipping lifeline across the Atlantic Ocean. Canada plays the central role in the campaign.

programme.title: War Story: Not One Step Back: The Battle of Stalingrad
programme.desc: In the summer of 1942, the Germans advance to seize the rich oilfields of the Caucasus. In their path, the city of Stalingrad, its Soviet defenders personally ordered by Stalin to “take not one step back".

programme.title: War Story: Behind Enemy Lines
programme.desc: Royal Canadian Air Force bombing operations play a crucial role in disrupting German infrastructure ahead of the Normandy invasion of June 1944. In the process, dozens of Canadian airmen are forced to bail out over occupied Belgium and France.

programme.title: War Story: Whistle for a Tiffy
programme.desc: From D-Day, Tactical Air Force fighter-bombers played a pivotal role in Allied battlefield success; Canadian soldiers knew they could always “whistle for a Tiffy”.

programme.title: War Story: Surviving Dieppe
programme.desc: The Dieppe assault of 19 August 1942 is the worst day in Canadian military history: in just 8 hours, 907 Canadians were killed. For 2,000 of their comrades, nearly three years of incarceration in German prison camps followed.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Anthony & Marq
programme.desc: Anthony is a war veteran who wears his heart on his sleeve. Over a year ago, he bonded online with a caring man named Marq. Today, they're head over heels in love - but what is Marq hiding? (S2, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Antoinette & Albert
programme.desc: A year after meeting 'T-lights' on Instagram, 'instaceleb' Antoinette is ready to meet him, but he always brushes off the idea. Is he really the online celebrity he claims to be?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Antwane & Tony
programme.desc: Nev and Max are contacted by Carmen who is sounding the alarm on behalf of her cousin, Antwane. He's been in a 3-year romance with a man named Tony that he met on a telephone chat line. (S3, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: It's been seven years since April met Dean in a chat room at the age of thirteen. During that time, Dean would often disappear for months at a time. Can Nev and Max help April find Dean? (S6, ep15)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Nev and Max receive emails from opposite sides of the same online romance, each concerned that the other may be a catfish! The guys are taken aback when one side decides to follow through with their marriage plans!

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Artis & Jess
programme.desc: Five months ago Artis met Jess online. Artis and Jess each were in relationships, but believed they'd found true love. But is Jess everything that she says she is? (S2, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Ashley & Mike
programme.desc: For over seven years, Ashley has sent dramatically altered photos of herself to her soul mate, Mike, to make her look thinner and more attractive to him. (S2, ep10)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: Goodbye Mike
programme.desc: With the Hitchuation over, the year may be winding down but the drama is ticking up for our Guidos. Ronnie reaches his breaking point, JWoww's divorce goes public, and Mike heads to jail.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: Thirty Days Later
programme.desc: JWoww needs to clear the air with Angelina and Ronnie, and she's out for blood. Meanwhile, Ronnie returns from recovery with a new outlook on life.

programme.title: Ex on the Beach: Kayleigh's Crisis
programme.desc: Get ready for more sun-soaked drama, as another set of sexy singles head to paradise for a summer of love... or so they think. This time, the drama is set to be more explosive than ever!

programme.title: Ex on the Beach: Love Triangles And Squares
programme.desc: The arrival of two exes is causing chaos in the Villa, and it's only going to get worse. Rogan's romance with Anita is about to be ruined when ex Jess arrives on the beach of doom.

programme.title: Ex on the Beach: I'm Sorry, I'm A Prick
programme.desc: Five exes are in the villa and everyone is on edge with the arrival of Gaz from Geordie Shore. Gary makes his move on Anita, they fall for each other and her Ex emerges from the sea.

programme.title: Ex on the Beach: Star Gazing
programme.desc: Joe's arrival stuns the villa and Anita is in pieces. Kayleigh tells Joe that Anita has been getting it on with two boys in the house. The next Ex is a familiar face. Welcome Charlotte!

programme.title: 48 Hours: Father and Son
programme.desc: A teenager makes a discovery that could prove his mother's death was not suicide.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Loved to Death
programme.desc: An investigation into the rise of violence surrounding relationship breakups among adolescents, as detailed in the story of Wayland, Massachusetts teen Lauren Astley, whose last encounter with her football player ex-boyfriend proved to be fatal

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Last Confession
programme.desc: Relatives of a beauty queen who was murdered more than 50 years ago suspect a priest committed the crime.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Crime and Punishment
programme.desc: Two women fight to keep the man convicted of killing their mother over 20 years earlier in prison, though he maintains his innocence.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: The investigation into the shooting death of retired NYPD officer Patrick Gilhuley, including interviews with jury members and a deconstruction of forensic evidence.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Preacher's Passion
programme.desc: A preacher searches for answers about his girlfriend's death.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bunker, Pt. 1
programme.desc: The IMF races a paid killer who is stalking a nuclear scientist forced by the enemy to work on a device that could upset the world power balance in the first of a two-part episode.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Bunker, Pt. 2
programme.desc: While trying to free a nuclear scientist and his wife from enemy hands, the IMF is trapped when a would-be assassin takes over one of Rollin's disguises in Part 2.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Nitro
programme.desc: The IMF finds itself only a second away from eternity when they intercept a nitroglycerine expert who plans to blow up the government house of a small country, thus provoking war with its neighbor nation.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Vault
programme.desc: Guest star Nehemiah Persoff as a corrupt Latin American official plots to loot his own country of $40,000,000 with the connivance of the IMF.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Nicole
programme.desc: Guest star Joan Collins, as a seductive double agent, endangers a vital IMF project when Jim Phelps falls in love with her.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Play It Safe!
programme.desc: It's always fun to share a day with Barney—but it's also important to learn how to "play it safe!" Baby Bop, wanting to be a good helper, has been attaching adhesive strips to her frustrated (and uninjured) brother, BJ.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When some of the children in the park invite Barney to join them for a race./When BJ starts to feel sick after eating too many sweets, he lies down in hopes of feeling better.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop can't find anybody to play with her. When the others see her feeling sad, they decide to play whatever she wants to play. The dinos and kids are planning a camp-out at the park.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Magic Caboose - Arts
programme.desc: Melanie is sad because she misses her friend who is visiting relatives in India. Barney shows his friends that it's fun to go to new places and see new things by taking them on an imaginary journey on the Magic Caboose!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ’s efforts to decorate the park go awry when he accidentally paints the caboose several different colors. Baby Bop can’t wait for BJ and Riff to go on their camping trip.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Coming on Strong
programme.desc: Exercise is good for everybody and every body! From running to touching toes to jumping jacks to some favorite songs and games, Barney and his friends grow strong while having fun with exercise.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Gift Of The Dinos - Winter
programme.desc: It's Christmas and BJ dreams of getting a new baseball glove to go with his baseball, while Riff hopes for new drumsticks to use his drum. Barney reminds them that Christmas is more than just getting gifts and helps them learn the meaning of Christmas.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Day and Night
programme.desc: With a little Barney magic, the children experience the differences between day and night!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Half Pipe Dreams
programme.desc: 1970s Z-Flex Jimmy Plumer Poolrider skateboard with artwork by Doug Smith; Kevlar bulletproof vest, ballistic facemask and a helmet used by S.W.A.T. teams; a pair of 1990s racing pocket bikes capable of going 80 mph.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Flying Ton, Creeping Allen
programme.desc: When a group of thugs try to bully Ton and Allen out of a Chinatown auction, the guys fight back, leading to a violent showdown and the discovery of both a rare Bornean blowgun and special effects wire harnesses.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ton's Driller Instinct
programme.desc: Ton & Allen encounter aggressive outdoorsmen in the Alaskan wilderness. The guys discover an 8-wheeled ATV that travels on both land & water and an air percussion hammer that can drill through solid rock!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Brew-Phoria
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go all in for an electric car, but with the batteries missing, a pricey refurb is their only shot at a profit. Will a home brewing system and high-end air rifles help soften the blow, or will they take a big loss?

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Cold Hard Cash
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go North to Alaska and get a cold reception from the local auctioneer. They find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers, including the most powerful production handgun in the world!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Weapons of Past Destruction
programme.desc: Knowing that Hollywood auctions are hit-and-miss, Allen and Ton buy inexpensive lockers that contain a polygraph machine, a samurai sword and a pair of Civil War shotguns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Gold 'n' Gloves
programme.desc: The Auction Hunters team goes toe-to-toe with Ton's evil twin! They find a medieval catapult designed for storming castles and Ton uncovers a hidden collection of gold bars worth thousands of dollars!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Trading Places
programme.desc: When an injury sidelines Allen, he stays at the shop while Ton takes Big Sis to the auction and goes rogue, ignoring Allen's advice and making risky purchases that could lose the partners a boatload of cash.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Night of the Digging Dead
programme.desc: A custom-built shark cage; 1900s pathologist's dissection toolkit; 1940s embalming pump and one of the first electric bone saws.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Allen vs. Ton
programme.desc: When Ton and Allen find themselves bidding against each other at an auction, the former partners battle it out in an epic showdown that leaves the fate of the pawnshop and their friendship in question.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Allen's Big Crush
programme.desc: The guys battle it out with their fierce former-employee, while a shill bidder threatens to ruin the day. When all hope seems lost, a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are their last chance to come out on top.

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: As Maci copes with the aftermath of the shooting, Cheyenne uses her platform to discuss racial injustice. Mackenzie's friends visit her in Florida and question her rekindled marriage. (S9, ep10)

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: Cheyenne is nervous for the results of Zach's genetic test that will determine whether their unborn child will have VLCAD. After not going to Leah's party, Amber tries to make amends. (S9, ep11)

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: Cheyenne and Zach have a gender reveal party and finally get the results of Zach's genetic test. Maci is shocked to learn that Ryan had a session with Bentley's therapist. (S9, ep12)

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: Catelynn and Tyler find out the gender of their baby with an at-home test. Mackenzie goes home to Oklahoma to surprise her dad and finds out he's still struggling with depression. (S9, ep15)

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: Heading into her 3rd trimester, Cheyenne needs Cory to help out more with Ryder but he has other plans. Catelynn is hesitant but Tyler wants to try ketamine therapy. (S9, ep16)

programme.title: Teen Mom OG

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries

programme.title: Red Shoe Diaries

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob’s building a ‘drying tunnel’ for drying Annie seaweed. Muck passes Mr Beasley who’s having a spot of bother with his washing. He decides to build Mr Beasley a drying tunnel for his washing.

programme.title: Trains and Treehouses
programme.desc: Bob and his ‘Can-Do’ crew are back on site with a brand new adventure! Join Bob as he builds a train set for Mr Bentley as a birthday surprise and helps find a family of squirrels a new tree-house home.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scrambler is playing with the Sunflower Valley children; Sunny, Saffron, Carlo and Cassia in the playground. It’s the last day before they have to go back to school in Bobsville and they are all sad to be leaving.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are finishing refurbishing the old watermill ready to begin milling the first Sunflower Valley flour. Work is just about to start when Dizzy hears a squeaking noise coming from above. There are bats in the old mill!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a stormy night, Wendy has to mend a chimney pot at Mrs Potts’, while Bob repairs a drainage pipe for Farmer Pickles. A wire fence has been blown away at the farm too, but fixing the pipe takes priority.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scoop and Dizzy have spent the night at Bob’s old yard in Bobsville to help Wendy with some digging and mixing. The machines all wish that Wendy could come and live out in Sunflower Valley.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is building a marshland walkway with his Dad’s help. Benny hears that the marsh is ‘like a jungle’ and becomes determined to finds some jungle animals like tigers. Every time he spots one, however, it turns out to be something very ordinary.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is replacing a potting shed on Mr Beasley’s allotment. In the old shed is a chest which Mr Beasley doesn’t need any more. Meanwhile Wendy calls at JJ’s for the materials for the new shed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Scrambler is desperate to help Bob build a drying barn for Farmer Pickles sunflower farm. Scruffty is also excited about the building job and runs and jumps about getting in everyone’s way.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is putting up some new signs in Sunflower Valley to help people find their way round the valley. Meanwhile Dizzy has been asked by Ela Stevenson if she’ll be the ‘walking bus’ and help the children get to school.

programme.title: Knights of Can-A-Lot

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Stephen Lawrence

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Colin Ireland

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Raoul Moat
programme.desc: The hunt for Raoul Moat was one of the largest in British history, after he wounded his ex-girlfriend, killed her new partner and shot and blinded police constable David Rathband.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Lee Rigby
programme.desc: In broad daylight on a busy Woolwich street on 22nd May 2013, serving soldier Fusilier Lee Rigby was attacked and murdered by Islamic extremists Michael Adebolajo and Michael Adebowale.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: The Philpotts

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Sarah Payne
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Sarah Payne's disappearance and murder shocked the nation. Here, Sarah's mum reveals her tireless campaign to protect other children from paedophilia.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Sister, Sistah

programme.title: Girlfriends: Willie or Won’t He II: The Last Chapter

programme.title: Girlfriends: The Taming of the Realtess

programme.desc: Just before Mother’s Day, Maya is disturbed when her mother announces she’s selling the house and moving to San Bernardino with her boyfriend. Toni has issues when her mother shows up unannounced for Mother’s Day and continually embarrasses her.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Just Dessert
programme.desc: Unable to work out living with Joan, Lynn moves in with William and the two hit it off in more ways than one; becoming casual, unattached sex buddies.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Into the Woods
programme.desc: Joan dumps Chris when she learns her ex-boyfriend, Sean, is moving back to town; but is crushed when Sean lies about being engaged just to avoid being in a relationship with her again.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Getting Our Act Together
programme.desc: Maya dreams of reuniting with Darnell, Lynn becomes a bartender and William tries to fast-track his partnership at the law firm.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Whole Truth

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: New information in the case of a woman accused of killing her fiance during a kayaking trip may prove her innocence.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Fatal Mistake

programme.title: Twin Peaks

programme.title: Twin Peaks

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Bobby and Shelly reaffirm their love. Cooper calls Shelly, Donna and Audrey together to warn them about Earle. Briggs shows Cooper a tape of Windom Earle making a report on his quest for the Black Lodge.
